result.execSummary:
The defendant Mary F. Schimming was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Submit to DNA sample, unless already provided.  Undergo any counseling per agent.  Absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances unless valid Rx.  Report valid Rx to agent within 2 working days.  No entry into bars, taverns and liquor stores or the where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  Submit to random urinalysis.    If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Sentencing hearing at 08-03-2015 10:30 am

Defendant Mary F. Schimming in court with attorney Blake J. Duren.  Defendant Mary F. Schimming in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and parties state appearances.  State state recommendations and PSI request to be done w/argued sentencing date.  Atty Duren agrees w/statement by State and enters guilty pleas.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds guilty.  DE advised of rights re: felony firearms possession and voting rights.  Court orders PSI and that is to be completed no later than 7/24/2015.  Sentencing to be set after that date.  Bonds continued pending sentencing excluding in 14CF77 where bond is revoked.  State states prior OWI convictions on the record.  All outstanding warrants would be quashed.

Defendant Mary F. Schimming by video from LEC with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Defendant Mary F. Schimming in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  State requests cash bond of $20,000.  Atty Middleton responds/DE currently working at Grede's.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $2,500.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact w/F.R., absolute sobriety at all times from alcohol and controlled substances and not to possess any controlled substances w/o valid prescription.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 11:00 am.  Return date scheduled for April 24, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
